DisplayString.Name: Veeam VMware High-Granularity MP
DisplayString.Description: Management Pack with additional performance metric collection rules for detailed performance monitoring. To use, manually add vSphere Clusters, Datastores, Hosts and/or VMs to the Group “Veeam VMware objects for high-granularity performance collection”. Note that this additional granular metric collection can significantly increase Ops Mgr database use. For details see the Veeam MP Help Center: http://www.veeam.com/documentation-guides-datasheets.html?prd=mp.

DisplayString.Name: Populate Veeam VMware objects for high-granularity performance collection Group
DisplayString.Description: This discovery rule populates the group 'Veeam VMware objects for high-granularity performance collection'

DisplayString.Name: cpuWaitPct
DisplayString.Description: Percentage of time during the last sample that the virtual machine CPU resources were in the "wait" state. For example, on a physical server with 2 CPU cores, during a 300 second interval 600 seconds of CPU resources are available. If the VM was in a "wait" state for 60 seconds the cpuWaitPct would be 10%.

DisplayString.Name: freePct on vDisks
DisplayString.Description: free % available on Guest OS VirtualDisk

DisplayString.Name: Veeam VMware objects for high-granularity performance collection
DisplayString.Description: Veeam VMware objects for high-granularity performance collection

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Veeam VMware High-Granularity MP, part of Veeam Management Pack for System Center.
See the Help Center for more information including reference lists of all Rules and Monitors and full set of User Guides for the Veeam MP for VMware.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule populates Veeam VMware objects for high-granularity performance collection Group.
Groups can be used in Operations Manager for targeting overrides, creating custom dashboards, diagrams and other views.
This group may be used for built-in views, discoveries or other functionality in the Veeam MP and should not be disabled or modified unless advised by Veeam support.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: Refer to the Microsoft System Center Online Documentation for more information on Operations Manager features such as discoveries.

Refer to the Veeam MP for VMware Documentation (especially the Operations Guide) for more details on advanced MP functionality such as Proxy agent monitoring, 'cascaded' discoveries, group management etc.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the performance metric VMGuest-cpu \ cpuWaitPct for VMware virtual machines.
Metric definition:

Percentage of time during the last sample that the virtual machine CPU resources were in the 'wait' state. For example, on a physical server with 2 CPU threads, during a 300 second interval 600 seconds of CPU resources are available. If the VM was in a "wait" state for 60 seconds the cpuWaitPct would be 10%.
Disabling this rule will stop collection of the metric into Ops Mgr and it will not be visible in views and reports. However, any monitor based on the same metric will continue to function.
To see all metrics collected in this class check the Veeam MP for VMware Metric Dictionary.

Use the Alerts View to see all current open issues for this object. Use the Events View to review any error and warning events for this object. Open a Performance View to see the performance metrics for this object and all contained objects. Open a Diagram View to analyze the relationships of this object to other components.

maml:section.maml:title: External
maml:section.maml:para: See the Help Center for more information including reference lists of all Rules and Monitors and full set of User Guides for the Veeam MP for VMware.
See the VMware Online Documentation for more information on VMware vSphere, in particular:

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the performance metric VMDatastore \ deviceReadLatency for VMware datastores.
Metric definition:
The average amount of time taken to complete a read from the physical device. This is the time from the device to the host HBA (in milliseconds).
Disabling this rule will stop collection of the metric into Ops Mgr and it will not be visible in views and reports. However, any monitor based on the same metric will continue to function.
To see all metrics collected in this class check the Veeam MP for VMware Metric Dictionary.

Use the Alerts View to see all current open issues for this object. Use the Events View to review any error and warning events for this object. Open a Performance View to see the performance metrics for this object and all contained objects. Open a Diagram View to analyze the relationships of this object to other components.

maml:section.maml:para: See the Help Center for more information including reference lists of all Rules and Monitors and full set of User Guides for the Veeam MP for VMware.
See the VMware Online Documentation for more information on VMware vSphere, in particular:

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the performance metric VMDatastore \ deviceWriteLatency for VMware datastores.
Metric definition:
The average amount of time taken to complete a write to the physical device. This is the time from the host HBA to the device (in milliseconds).
Disabling this rule will stop collection of the metric into Ops Mgr and it will not be visible in views and reports. However, any monitor based on the same metric will continue to function.
To see all metrics collected in this class check the Veeam MP for VMware Metric Dictionary.

Use the Alerts View to see all current open issues for this object. Use the Events View to review any error and warning events for this object. Open a Performance View to see the performance metrics for this object and all contained objects. Open a Diagram View to analyze the relationships of this object to other components.

maml:section.maml:para: See the Help Center for more information including reference lists of all Rules and Monitors and full set of User Guides for the Veeam MP for VMware.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the performance metric VMDatastore \ IOPS for VMware datastores.
Metric definition:
Number of input/output operations per second, calculated as total of (reads + writes) divided by the collection interval.
Disabling this rule will stop collection of the metric into Ops Mgr and it will not be visible in views and reports. However, any monitor based on the same metric will continue to function.
To see all metrics collected in this class check the Veeam MP for VMware Metric Dictionary.

Use the Alerts View to see all current open issues for this object. Use the Events View to review any error and warning events for this object. Open a Performance View to see the performance metrics for this object and all contained objects. Open a Diagram View to analyze the relationships of this object to other components.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the performance metric VMGuest-cpu \ cpuIdlePct for VMware virtual machines.
Metric definition:
Percent of time that the CPU was idle for this virtual machine during the last interval. For ESX 3.x systems, this value is in milliseconds.
Disabling this rule will stop collection of the metric into Ops Mgr and it will not be visible in views and reports. However, any monitor based on the same metric will continue to function.
To see all metrics collected in this class check the Veeam MP for VMware Metric Dictionary.

Disabling this rule will stop collection of the metric into Ops Mgr and it will not be visible in views and reports. However, any monitor based on the same metric will continue to function.
To see all metrics collected in this class check the Veeam MP for VMware Metric Dictionary.

Use the Alerts View to see all current open issues for this object. Use the Events View to review any error and warning events for this object. maml:section.maml:para: This rule collects the performance metric VMHost-memory \ memorySharedMB for VMware vSphere hosts.
